Languages.name: Javascript
Languages.description: Javascript is a multi-paradigm dynamic language used for web development. Its syntax is based on the Java and C languages. It supports object-oriented programming with object prototypes, and it can be used for front-end or back-end development by using different libraries.
Languages.information: My first experience using Javascript was through Wilmington. I had not learned much web development techniques before, so Javascript was interesting.

Languages.name: Java
Languages.description: Java is an object-oriented programming language owned by Oracle. It was developed in 1995 by James Gosling.
Languages.information: Java was the first language I ever learned. When I learn new languages, I compare the basics in my head to how it works with Java.

Languages.name: C#
Languages.description: C# is an object-oriented programming language created by Microsoft that runs on the .Net Framework. It comes from the C family, and was first released in 2002.
Languages.information: I started learning C# on my own without a course because I had a textbook. It was interesting figuring out projects and solutions, which Java did not make me use.

Languages.name: Python
Languages.description: Python is an easy to learn programming language with a simple approach to object-oriented programming. It was released in 1991.
Languages.information: Python was a really interesting language. It was the second language I learned. At first I did not like having no semicolons and some of the other syntax, but the simplicity of Python is nice.
